Reviews.Title: The Lumix DMC-FS25 delivers! 5-Stars
Reviews.Author: L. Miranda
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FS25 camera is an excellent point and shoot camera.  It delivers on what it promises.  The Intelligent Auto feature works really well in a range of shooting environments. One button at the top of the camera toggles between the iA function and last camera setting.  Face detection and auto focus (AF) tracking on moving objects are quite cool features and useful features, especially when you are trying to get a good snap of your kids or pets.  The camera works smoothly on MacOS X with iPhoto (although the boxed PHOTOfunSTUDIO software only works on a PC - but you don't need or want it if you have a Mac).  The photo quality is excellent.  It's has a 3X optical zoom, and that's all I really need (it also has a digital zoom).  The backlit display gives you a realistic preview of what you're capturing - I don't miss a viewfinder even outdoors in bright light.  Burst shooting with and without flash works well, although the photo res is reduced in this mode.  The video recording is better than nearly all point and shoots in the price range (although it is not as great of the Lumix LX3 - at approximately twice the list price of DMC-FS25) allowing for 16:9 wide-screen video recording: WVGA (848 x 480) at 30 frames per second.  It also takes standard 4:3 (640 x 480) video.  For charging you need to take the battery out of the camera, but the charger is quite small and it is compatible with worldwide 110-240V power, although you still need to bring a plug adapter.  I've had my camera for several weeks (used it daily for photos and video) and I have only had to charged once after the initial charge up.  The battery door looks delicate but it should be fine with normal use.  In general the build quality is high, the black brush look is very cool, and the camera feels great to hold.  It is much easier to slip into your pocket than the Lumix-TZ5. My DMC-FS25 outperforms my previous Sony Cybershot DSC P200 .  The SD memory card is great.  I have a 8GB SD card. You can get a lot more GB storage for less $ than with Sony's memory sticks.The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FS25 is great camera!  The advanced features are definitely worth the extra dollars from the Lumix DMC-FS15 or DMC-FS7 models.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Money!
Reviews.Author: E. Goris
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FS25 is a great camera for the money! Similar cameras with the same megapixels, features, and zoom ran much more when I was looking to buy a new camera. It feels durable in your hands, looks classy, and is a nice size; not too small but small enough to fit in my husband's pants pocket. We mainly use this camera for get-togethers with friends and family and vacations. Actually, the day we got this camera in the mail we left for a vacation to Florida. It took great pictures on the beach, of sunsets, and on a boat tour at night. It has a very nice zoom for a point-and-shoot camera and all of our pictures from our vacation turned out great! We were getting compliments on it our entire trip! We previously had a FujiFilm J10 and this camera is SO much better. It was easy to see the screen even in bright sunlight on the beach. The shutter speed is good (much better than the Fuji was). I had no problems taking pictures of my fast-moving niece. The video feature is good as well, don't buy the camera for this feature, but for short clips it gets the job done with audio and no delays. I have not read the manual that comes with the camera yet but flipping through it I found many more features that are not mentioned in the product description that looked neat. The software that came with the camera, PhotoFunStudio is easy to use and integrates well with a PC. I was able to still save all of the photos in MyPictures but access them through the Panasonic software. The battery life is great as well, it was charged right before our trip two weeks ago and has not been charged yet and we have taken about 300 photos in those two weeks!I would recommend this camera to people who want a quality camera that takes great pictures of everyday moments, special occasions, and vacations. It takes excellent pictures; did not miss a moment of our vacation and worked well when snapping pictures of my toddler niece.

Reviews.Title: This is a great snapshot camera for the casual photographer
Reviews.Author: M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these cameras for myself.  I took it on vacation and once I saw the ease of use and the resulting photos, I was so impressed that I bought two more as Christmas gifts for my son and daughter.  They are also very impressed with their new cameras.The pictures are very crisp (Leica lens) and the "Intelligent Auto" adjusts the camera exposure settings to produce a better photo than all but the most serious photographer could have done.  The menus and controls could be a bit easier to use, but most of the time you will just press the "IA" (Intelligent Auto) button right there on top.  The camera is just the right size, compact and very thin. Any smaller would be hard to hold properly.The lens also provides a very usable zoom range.  In my old 35mm days, I shot most pictures with lenses between 28 & 110mm. This camera gives you a zoom that just covers that range.  If you want a long telephoto lens, or 15/1 zoom, look elsewhere.Anyone looking for a small compact snapshot camera, that takes great photos with a minimum input from the user, should be very happy with one of these.

Reviews.Title: Not made very well
Reviews.Author: JWeb
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to be something I could pop into my pocket so I didn't have to lug around my DSLR. The photos are decent enough but my biggest gripe is the build quality (and maybe the slow focus). I bought this back in September and by the end of October and about maybe 1000 images, the lens would not retract back into the camera after shooting. I sent it back to Amazon and got a replacement. Here it is February and I just sent that one back to Panasonic. Now the lens will not always extend when the camera is turned on and I get a message to turn the camera off, then on again. When the lens does this I have to turn the camera off and on 3 or 4 times before I can shoot. In addition to this a few weeks ago I noticed an attached ring that surrounds the lens started to detach from the camera. Every time I put the camera in my pocket this became more and more detached to the point I had to remove it since it was barely hanging on.My overall impression of this camera is that it's just not made very well. My old small Canon that was handed down to someone else is a tank compared to this. I took the Canon on the Appalachian trail in all kinds of weather. I really don't know if I could ever trust this Lumix for that kind of trip.

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera!
Reviews.Author: Harnz
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It's actually the second one I bought...had its predecessor for a couple years, then gave that one to my spouse and got this new one for myself. The viewer-LCD is huge and it takes great photos and video with sound. Only complaints: Not great getting video in darker conditions (even with increased exposure) and you can't zoom once you start a video. I'd recommend taking the time to go through the User's Guide to get a handle on all the features--many more than I'll ever use.In spite of the couple video shortcomings, I love it and highly recommend it if you want a fairly easy-to-use camera that's small and fun.

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera in this price range
Reviews.Author: RW
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera for about 3 months now, and it is everything as advertised and more.  The joystick selector is kind of small, but easy to use once you get used to it.  This camera makes me a better photographer than I am, and I have fewer blurry and throw away/delete pictures as a result.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera!
Reviews.Author: L. Lloyd
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera.  If you are looking for good quality pictures with the ease of pushing a button, this is for you! It does have some manual settings you can use for special pictures. I have tried some of those but not all of them.  I like the AF tracking, especially since I have kids that can't always stand still.  I have taken pictures of moving things and they are as clear as the still pictures.  I have yet to see a blurred picture! Great camera and features for the money.  I researched awhile before purchasing. I could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: Not a satisfied customer
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Sander
Reviews.Content: I've had my camera exactly a month. Nothing was wrong with it until the today when the zoom kept going out of focus and then a screen telling me to turn the camera off then back on. I did this and it finally said zoom error. It won't work at all now and the 30 days return was up on that day.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: retired teacher "Bob"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take with me on bike trips and hikes.  My digital SLR is just too large for that purpose.  I did a lot of online research and came to the conclusion that this was the best reasonably priced point and shoot camera. It does just what I want it to do.  It takes excellent pictures and is small enough to put in a pocket.  The menus are not intuitive and require some adjustments.  This is a great camera if you use it for its intended use.  Don't expect digital SLR quality, but you will still get excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: A very nice Camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Subramanya "AnDi"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after plenty of research. Its been about 3 weeks now and i am totally satisfied with it. Most of the time i use the iA mode(Intelligent Auto) for shooting pictures. The pictures have been pretty good in different situations. Love this feature. No hassles of adjusting anything manually. I let the camera take care of all the required settings. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Geat Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are not camera buffs by any means. We wanted to replace our older large, clunky camera with one that was small and a no brainer. This is it. True point and shoot. There are a lot of features if you want them. The ease of use and the quality of the pictures are hard to beat. Panasonic makes great cameras and this is definitely one of them.

Reviews.Title: big things from a small camera
Reviews.Author: Alfred F. Ghianda
Reviews.Content: it was great right out of the box.my wife had no trouble using it the first.and thats a lot to say for her.it`s zoom is great the lcd srceen is big for such a small camera 3".overall i recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: I really like that it was small enough to not take up too much room in my purse.  Most importantly, it takes really good pictures and easy to use!  The battery lasts a good long time because it has a feature that automatically shuts it down to power save if you forget to turn it off.

Reviews.Title: Camera has a lens retraction issue
Reviews.Author: Utkarsh Seth "Utk"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in April 10. It is not a good camera at all. Specially the picture is not sharp. The videos are a little blurred for a 12MP.The most important thing is this camera has a defective lens track.Most users ( google it ) suffer from this issue. The lens would not retract back into the camera after shooting or when you switch it on they won't come out.All you a get is either a lens error or a system zoom error. It asks you to switch off the camera and turn it on again. I ignored this error for 2 months and kept switching on / off the camera considering I am a novice. But later one day , the lens got stuck. Amazon is great in customer service , they offered me a refund. But if you take them to panasonic , you are in for some major drill. They ask you to ship it too a warehouse in TX and it goes on from there.Check issues with this camera on google and decide if you still need to buy it.I might go for a nikon , sony or a canon.

Reviews.Title: Faulty zoom mechanism
Reviews.Author: William A. Hudson "wahwahnyc"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for the Leica optics, which are indeed good, but lens/zoom mechanism has broken down after less than a year's (light) use. I've never dropped the camera or mishandled in any way. Now the camera is completely non-functional. By contrast, I carried my Canon PowerShot around the world and took thousands of photos under challenging conditions and it performed well for more than 5 years.

Reviews.Title: lumix
Reviews.Author: BlueStar
Reviews.Content: I needed something other than my cell phone to toss in my motorcycle saddlebags that would provide high quality pictures, ease of operation and a reasonably good zoom to suck in distant objects. The Panasonic offer all of those capabilities and more. This camera was about a hundred dollars cheaper than the closest 12megapixel competitor at the time I purchased it and I did so after reading several reviews for P and S cameras. The system sports a 5x optical zoom which nearly doubles the effective zoom compared to other cameras of the same size. Also convenient is the appx. 3.2 inch LCD which makes it the shot nearly visible to old eyes without the use of Bi-focals. The biggest complaint I have so far is the apparent lack of timer on the camera. I specifically wanted a camera I could put on a tri-pod to take self shots with my motorcycle at scenic locales. Haven't found the operation for it if it has it. Maybe one of these days I will actually read the book and see. The on-board menus are a little confusing especially if you are in a rush to take a picture but the camera has a lot of capability including movie mode and multiple lighting, ASA setting, ISO settings and other features. Battery life is good and it uses standard SD cards which are pretty much available everywhere now. It's good buy and I had no problems with delivery or the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Quality with good price
Reviews.Author: princesafenix
Reviews.Content: This product is so good...I had the last version of this camara and I decided to bought the new version because I know is an awesome product... you don't need to buy batteries... you only need to charger the battery of the camara..and the quality of he pictures is amazing, you will have picture like a professional

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-F525
Reviews.Author: Heidi L. Stutelberg "Heidi S"
Reviews.Content: I like this brand. It's thinner than my last one which was only a 6 mp. Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Very Favorable
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Vespa
Reviews.Content: I have been a professional photographer since 1963--and while what this camera can do amazes me, the controls are too small and the programs too elaborate to really do it justice. The white-card color balance, for instance, changed nothing when I used quartz lights.  It does most everything so well, it's a shame to throw in features that are a compromise.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: B. Arant
Reviews.Content: We looked at several other cameras in this price range. This one has the features and picture quality of cameras twice the price. I use it more than my Panasonic LUMIX SLR because it is so easy to carry in your pocket!

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly Good Quality Pictures
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Peart "Richard"
Reviews.Content: I was surpried to see how well the pictures turned out for a non-SLR camera.  I also liked the quality of the video and the over all ease of using this camera.  I would definitely reccommend it for someone who just want a simple camera and not have to mess with a bunch of settings.

Reviews.Title: Fun, simple, great images
Reviews.Author: Stu Baldwin
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera for the money, and I am pleased with my purchase. A docking station to upload and work a little magic would have been nice, but I guess for the price I can't reasonably expect such.

Reviews.Title: Bad color
Reviews.Author: L. Chun "charmedlc"
Reviews.Content: I loved the way this camera looked and it's portable size.  But I had problems with the flash and/or color in the photos I took at night.My friends and I love to take pictures when we are out on the town.  On the night I took some test shots, we had multiple cameras taking the same shot.  My camera was set to the default Auto IS to take the pictures.  After comparing all of our photos, it was clear to see that the color in my photos were not warm enough.  The subjects looked overexposed, washed out, and more blue.  I changed the camera coloring to "natural" and lowered the ISO, but that did not help.I'm not sure if the camera I had was defective, but I decided to return it anyway.  I'm now looking into purchasing one of the Canon Powershots since most of my friends have those.

Reviews.Title: Decent wide angle
Reviews.Author: Stephen714
Reviews.Content: It's true this camera comes with all sorts of bells and whistles, but the bottom line is picture quality.  It's 12 MP can't compare with my previous Fuji that's 4 years old with 6 MP.  Every picture that comes out of this Panasonic needs to be edited for improved clarity and sharpness.  It's not an optional step, it's a necessary step unfortunately.It's one good feature is the 29 mm wide angle lens.  Also the LCD screen is large and bright and easy to use...that is if you don't mind the lack of a viewfinder. A camera with a viewfinder gives inherently better pictures because you are bracing the camera against your face when shooting and this stability makes a big difference in picture quality.  Aside from lackluster pictures, my biggest complaint about this camera is that the battery must actually be removed from the camera in order to charge it.  This is a totally unnecessary hassle.  Panasonic does sell an ac adapter but I am unable to find out if the adapter is solely for use in taking pictures or if it will charge the battery also. One last problem is that there is some contradictory and unclear information in the user manual.  I've been trying to contact Panasonic tech support since I received the camera, but apparently their contact page is just for show as they ignore tech support questions completetly.  Truthfully I am very dissapointed with this camera and would not purchase it over again.  (If my 4 year old Fuji 810 was still available, I'd buy another in a minute.)  If you want a small wide angle cheap camera for unimportant snapshots, then buy this camera.  For anything more serious, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Electronic problems
Reviews.Author: chinaski
Reviews.Content: My camera freezes the same way a computer does. The picture on the screen is frozen, the lens is blocked. out of course. And the camera can not be turned off.This only happens, when the battery gets low. Replacing the battery and resetting the thing fixes the problem.Thing is I don't carry a spare batt. all the time.I am moving to Switzerland in two days, so I did not contacted customer support.

Reviews.Title: Camara was sold as NEW but box had been opened and NO manual
Reviews.Author: CGarber
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera 3 stars for the plain fact that the box had been opened and there was no manual in the box.  When you pay for a new product is it too much to ask that you recieve an un-opened box.  The camera itself is what I wanted, a simple point and shoot that takes decent pictures in most situations.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel resolution captures enough detail for poster-size prints
5x MEGA optical image-stabilized zoom; 29mm wide-angle Leica DC Vario-Elmar lens
Intelligent Auto (iA) mode; Face Detection
3.0-inch LCD screen
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FS25 12MP Digital Camera with 5x MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3 inch LCD (Black)
